sentiment_score_definition: x <= -0.35: Bearish; -0.35 < x <= -0.15: Somewhat-Bearish; -0.15 < x < 0.15: Neutral; 0.15 <= x < 0.35: Somewhat_Bullish; x >= 0.35: Bullish
relevance_score_definition: 0 < x <= 1, with a higher score indicating higher relevance.

feed.title: BKV Corp. reports Q4 adjusted EPS 29c, consensus 29c
feed.summary: BKV Corp. announced its Q4 adjusted EPS of 29 cents, meeting the consensus estimate. The company reported Q4 revenue of $330.09 million, exceeding the consensus of $260.22 million. CEO Chris Kalnin highlighted 2025 as a pivotal year, marked by significant milestones including a CCUS joint venture, the Bedrock acquisition, expanded Power JV ownership, and strengthened balance sheet.

feed.title: Electrovaya To Host Investor Webcast on March 5, 2026
feed.summary: Electrovaya Inc. announced it will host an investor webcast presentation on March 5, 2026, at 2:00 PM EST. The webcast will feature CEO Dr. Raj DasGupta and CFO John Gibson, who will discuss Electrovaya's corporate strategy, business model, and technology, followed by an interactive Q&A session for investors. This event provides an opportunity for investors to gain insight into the company's operations and future plans.

feed.title: Dynatrace to Present at Upcoming Investor Conference
feed.summary: Dynatrace (NYSE: DT) announced that its executives will present at the Morgan Stanley Technology, Media, and Telecom Conference on Wednesday, March 4, at 2:30 p.m. ET. A webcast of the presentation will be available on the Investor Relations section of the Dynatrace website and archived for 30 days. Dynatrace is a leading AI-powered observability platform focused on transforming digital ecosystems for businesses.

feed.title: How Strong 2025 Results And A Major Buyback At Euronet Worldwide (EEFT) Have Changed Its Investment Story
feed.summary: Euronet Worldwide reported higher fourth-quarter and full-year 2025 results, with sales reaching US$1,108.7 million and US$4,244.2 million respectively, and net income of US$51.5 million and US$309.5 million. The company also completed a significant share repurchase program, buying back 35.01% of its shares since 2022, which amplified its earnings per share. This buyback program is a key factor influencing Euronet's investment narrative, making per-share earnings more impactful for investors weighing future prospects against regulatory and competitive pressures.

feed.title: Do Luxury Hotel Sales And Buybacks Reshape The Bull Case For Host Hotels & Resorts (HST)?
feed.summary: Host Hotels & Resorts (HST) recently reported strong Q4 and full-year 2025 results, announced a dividend, and completed a significant share repurchase program. The company also sold two luxury Four Seasons resorts for $1.10 billion, strategically divesting assets. While these actions reinforce the investment narrative, the core challenge for HST remains the normalization of business and group travel against potential margin pressures from rising wages and climate-related disruptions.

feed.title: MGG.DE MGM Resorts Intl (XETRA) up 6.60% 26 Feb 2026: eye €38.59 resistance
feed.summary: MGM Resorts International (MGG.DE) saw its stock jump 6.60% to €35.05 on XETRA on February 26, 2026, driven by technical buying and sector rotation. The article highlights immediate resistance at €38.59, offering a 10.09% short-term upside, while Meyka AI's yearly forecast projects a downside. Investors are advised to monitor Macau developments and debt metrics due to the company's high leverage and volatile tourism exposure.

feed.title: FTC says Walmart agreed to $100 million judgment to settle deceptive earnings charges
feed.summary: Walmart has agreed to a $100 million judgment to resolve allegations from the U.S. Federal Trade Commission (FTC) that it caused delivery drivers to lose tens of millions of dollars in earnings. The settlement addresses charges of deceptive practices by the retail giant. This agreement was announced in a statement by the FTC.

feed.title: Barclays Cuts Dine Brands Global (NYSE:DIN) Price Target to $30.00
feed.summary: Barclays has lowered its price target for Dine Brands Global (NYSE:DIN) from $40.00 to $30.00 while maintaining an "equal weight" rating, aligning with other analysts who have an average price target of $29.86 and a consensus "Hold" rating. The company reported mixed Q4 results, with adjusted EPS beating estimates but revenue missing some expectations and a GAAP loss due to an impairment charge, though management highlighted franchise growth and capital returns as key priorities. Institutional investors have recently adjusted their positions in Dine Brands Global, with a significant portion of the company's stock owned by institutional investors and hedge funds.

feed.title: Equifax, Inc. (NYSE:EFX) Announces Dividend Increase - $0.56 Per Share
feed.summary: Equifax, Inc. (NYSE:EFX) announced a 12% increase in its quarterly dividend to $0.56 per share, payable on March 17th to stockholders of record on March 9th. This increase suggests an annualized dividend yield of 1.1% and maintains a conservative payout ratio around 21.4%. The company also reported strong quarterly results, beating EPS and revenue expectations, and provided optimistic guidance for FY2026.

feed.title: Keurig Dr Pepper (NASDAQ:KDP) Price Target Raised to $32.00 at Barclays
feed.summary: Barclays has increased its price target for Keurig Dr Pepper (NASDAQ:KDP) from $30.00 to $32.00, maintaining an "equal weight" rating, indicating a potential 4.72% upside. This follows KDP's strong quarterly earnings, where the company surpassed analyst expectations with $0.60 EPS and $4.50 billion in revenue, and subsequently issued positive FY2026 EPS guidance. Other analysts, including Wells Fargo and Piper Sandler, have also set higher price targets, contributing to a "Moderate Buy" consensus rating for the stock.

feed.title: Sempra Energy (SRE) Reaffirms 2026 Earnings Forecast
feed.summary: Sempra Energy (SRE) has reaffirmed its adjusted EPS forecast for fiscal year 2026, targeting between $4.80 and $5.30, closely aligning with market expectations. The company serves a large utility customer base in the U.S., distributing natural gas and electricity, and has significant infrastructure investments. While SRE shows strong revenue, the financial analysis also highlights concerns regarding debt, profitability margins, and an Altman Z-Score indicating potential financial instability.

feed.title: Eni can now receive oil from Venezuela as payment for gas, CEO says
feed.summary: Eni's CEO, Claudio Descalzi, announced that Venezuela can now pay for gas from the Perla offshore field with oil due to eased U.S. sanctions, resolving a significant debt situation. Eni is exploring joint ventures with U.S. groups to increase oil output in Venezuela, which would help recover the approximately $3 billion owed to them. Additionally, Descalzi noted that Eni might eventually export some of the Perla facility's gas to Europe, thus aiding in replacing liquefied natural gas supplies previously sourced from Russia.

feed.title: eBay to lay off about 800 employees
feed.summary: This article reports that eBay is planning to lay off approximately 800 employees. The article is very short, providing only this primary piece of information.

feed.title: Jim Cramer Doesn't Want to Bet Against Booking Holding (BKNG)
feed.summary: Jim Cramer expressed reluctance to bet against Booking Holdings Inc. (BKNG) despite recent negativity, citing positive remarks from American Airlines and the company's strong position. Morgan Stanley upgraded BKNG to Overweight, noting its crucial role in the travel industry and ability to leverage user data for improved margins, even with the growth of AI. The article mentions that while BKNG shows potential, some AI stocks may offer greater returns and less risk.

feed.title: Rock Entertainment Group, Bedrock, Live Nation partner on practice facility-adjacent music venue
feed.summary: Rock Entertainment Group, Bedrock, and Live Nation are collaborating to open a new 6,200-seat outdoor music venue in Cleveland by May 2028. This venue, situated next to the Cleveland Clinic Global Peak Performance Center, is part of Bedrock's $3.5 billion "The Riverfront" redevelopment project and marks Live Nation's broader investment in mixed-use music venues near sports facilities. The project aims to bring national touring acts to Cleveland, representing the first large new music venue in the city in two decades.

feed.title: Equinix, CPPIB Near $4B Deal for atNorth – Report
feed.summary: Equinix and Canada Pension Plan Investment Board (CPPIB) are reportedly close to finalizing a deal to acquire atNorth Holding, a Nordic data center operator. The acquisition of Iceland-based atNorth, currently owned by Partners Group Holding, could be valued at approximately $4 billion, including debt. A transaction announcement might occur as early as this week, though discussions are still advanced and subject to potential delays.

feed.title: TJX Delivers Q4 Beat, Analysts Praise 'Notable MarMaxx Strength'
feed.summary: TJX Companies (NYSE: TJX) reported a strong fourth-quarter beat, with total sales up 8.5% year-on-year and earnings of $1.43 per share, surpassing analyst expectations. Analysts from BTIG and Telsey Advisory Group praised the company's performance, particularly "notable strength at MarMaxx," and highlighted TJX's resilience despite macroeconomic challenges. Both firms reaffirmed their positive ratings and raised price targets for the stock.

feed.title: Jim Cramer Discusses Caterpillar (CAT) Stock
feed.summary: Jim Cramer highlighted Caterpillar Inc. (NYSE:CAT) as a stock of interest, noting its strong performance with a 124% increase over the past year and 28% year-to-date. Bank of America raised its price target for CAT to $825, maintaining a Buy rating, citing demand for turbines beyond data centers. Cramer also pointed out that hedge funds are keenly interested in Caterpillar's power products.

feed.title: 3 Hotel Stocks to Watch for Now as Industry Headwinds Persist
feed.summary: The hotel and motel industry faces challenges from elevated operating costs, economic uncertainty, and cooling demand despite growth strategies. While the industry underperformed the S&P 500 in the past year, a gradual improvement is expected from 2026. Marriott (MAR), Hilton (HLT), and Hyatt (H) are identified as key stocks to watch, benefiting from strong RevPAR, unit growth, and strategic initiatives, despite the overall "dull prospects" indicated by the Zacks Industry Rank.

feed.title: Jim Cramer Says Advanced Micro Devices (AMD)'s Turnaround Is One of The Greatest In History
feed.summary: Jim Cramer has praised Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) for its impressive turnaround. The company's shares are up by 105% over the past year, despite a recent 4% year-to-date drop and a 17% decline in February after Q4 earnings. Analysts from Baird and Evercore ISI remain optimistic, raising price targets due to AI demand tailwinds and a new significant deal with Meta for GPUs and CPUs.

feed.title: Apple (AAPL) Got The Best Free Ride, Says Jim Cramer
feed.summary: Jim Cramer believes Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) received the "best free ride" by choosing to partner with Google for AI development instead of heavily investing in its own AI infrastructure. Despite investor concerns about AI feature delays, analysts at Wedbush and Evercore ISI maintain Outperform ratings, with Wedbush setting a $350 price target and Evercore ISI a $330 target. Cramer views Apple's strategy as a "masterstroke" that leveraged Google's Gemini.

feed.title: Jim Cramer Wonders Why People Are Selling Home Depot (HD) Shares
feed.summary: Jim Cramer expressed bewilderment regarding investors selling Home Depot (HD) shares despite the company reporting better-than-expected fiscal fourth-quarter earnings, beating analyst estimates for both revenue and EPS. He highlighted that while some peers experienced drops in sales, Home Depot's same-store sales grew slightly. Cramer questions the sellers' reasons, especially given his belief in the company's reliability and its consistent performance.

feed.title: Ex-Dividend Reminder: Martin Marietta Materials, Stepan and Core Natural Resources
feed.summary: Martin Marietta Materials Inc. (MLM), Stepan Co. (SCL), and Core Natural Resources Inc (CNR) are set to trade ex-dividend on March 2, 2026, for their upcoming quarterly dividends. Martin Marietta will pay $0.83, Stepan Co. $0.395, and Core Natural Resources $0.10. The article notes the percentage drop in stock price expected for each company due to the ex-dividend date and provides historical dividend charts for investors to assess stability.

feed.title: Jim Cramer on Chevron: "I Would Hold on to That"
feed.summary: Jim Cramer expressed strong confidence in Chevron (CVX), advising investors to hold onto the stock due to its consistent performance and attractive 3.85% dividend yield. He highlighted Chevron's robust cash flow, significant stock buyback program, and potential benefits from its business operations in Venezuela. Cramer views Chevron as a long-time favorite for its consistency and considers its current position promising.

feed.title: BofA Invests Nearly $40 Million into American Workforce Skills in 2025
feed.summary: Bank of America announced a nearly $40 million investment in 2025 towards workforce development initiatives, partnering with over 100 universities and 600 nonprofits. These efforts resulted in 86,400 individuals finding livable-wage jobs and 265,000 accessing training programs. The initiative aims to close skills gaps, address talent shortages, and strengthen local economies across the U.S.

feed.title: Jim Cramer on Generac: "It's Going to the Stars"
feed.summary: Jim Cramer commented on Generac Holdings Inc. (NYSE: GNRC), highlighting its shift from a business-to-consumer to a business-to-business model, which he believes has propelled its growth. While Cramer sees great potential in Generac, a previous sentiment from October 2025 noted that the company had not bet big enough on the data center market, causing a stock slump. The article also suggests that certain AI stocks may offer greater upside and less downside risk than GNRC.

feed.title: Jim Cramer on Take-Two Interactive: "What a Buy That Is"
feed.summary: Jim Cramer expressed bullish sentiment towards Take-Two Interactive (TTWO), calling it a "great stock" and "what a buy that is," despite a market sell-off driven by fears of AI disruption, specifically Google's Project Genie. He highlighted the upcoming release of Grand Theft Auto VI as a significant positive for the company. Cramer believes the market's reaction to AI threats is overblown for TTWO, suggesting it creates a buying opportunity.

feed.title: Encore Capital Group (NASDAQ:ECPG) Price Target Raised to $90.00
feed.summary: Citizens Jmp has raised its price target for Encore Capital Group (NASDAQ:ECPG) to $90.00 from $75.00, citing a potential upside of nearly 40%. This adjustment comes after the company reported strong Q4 results, surpassing earnings and revenue expectations, and provided robust FY 2026 EPS guidance of $12.00, significantly above consensus. Despite the positive outlook and analyst upgrades, investors are cautioned about the company's negative net margin, high leverage, and recent insider selling.

feed.title: Qualcomm Appoints Kevin O’Buckley as Executive Vice President, Global Operations and Supply Chain
feed.summary: Qualcomm has appointed Kevin O’Buckley as the executive vice president of Global Operations and Supply Chain, effective March 2, 2026. He will lead the company's global semiconductor operations, including manufacturing engineering and supply chain, reporting to Akash Palkhiwala. O’Buckley brings three decades of operational and commercial leadership experience from Intel, IBM, GlobalFoundries, and Marvell.

feed.title: JPMorgan Chase & Co. Increases AutoZone (NYSE:AZO) Price Target to $4,300.00
feed.summary: JPMorgan Chase & Co. has raised its price target for AutoZone (NYSE:AZO) to $4,300.00 from $4,100.00, reiterating an "overweight" rating and suggesting an 18.07% upside. AutoZone currently holds a "Moderate Buy" consensus rating among analysts with an average target of $4,279.58, despite recently missing quarterly EPS estimates but showing an 8.2% year-over-year revenue increase. Insider transactions over the last three months include purchases totaling $1.18 million and sales amounting to $34.18 million.

feed.title: Ex-Dividend Reminder: FNB, Regions Financial and Goldman Sachs Group
feed.summary: FNB Corp (FNB), Regions Financial Corp (RF), and Goldman Sachs Group Inc (GS) are set to trade ex-dividend on March 2, 2026, for their upcoming quarterly dividends. FNB will pay $0.12, RF will pay $0.265, and GS will pay $4.50. Investors should anticipate a slight dip in share prices for these stocks corresponding to the dividend amount on the ex-dividend date.

feed.title: Jim Cramer Prefers Texas Instruments and Analog Devices Over Rambus
feed.summary: Jim Cramer recently commented on Rambus stock, stating a preference for Texas Instruments and Analog Devices in the same sector. While acknowledging Rambus's good technology and growth, he suggested it hasn't kept pace with competitors. Cramer ultimately "blessed" a long-term position in Rambus for a caller, noting its value against growth.

feed.title: Jim Cramer on Gartner: “We’re Going to Have to Say No to That”
feed.summary: Jim Cramer expressed a negative view on Gartner (NYSE: IT), advising against investing in the stock due to a "not great quarter" and concerns that AI advancements could easily disrupt its business model. He noted that Gartner was one of the worst performers in the S&P 500 in 2025, with its business model as a technology research middleman being challenged by the accessibility of information through AI. Cramer suggests that other AI stocks hold greater promise for higher returns.

feed.title: Has The Humana (HUM) Share Slump Opened Up A Valuation Opportunity Now
feed.summary: Humana's stock has experienced a significant decline, falling 33.4% year-to-date, prompting questions about its current valuation. Simply Wall St's analysis, utilizing a Discounted Cash Flow model and Price-to-Earnings ratio, suggests that Humana is currently undervalued by 82.6% and undervalued based on its P/E ratio compared to a proprietary Fair Ratio. The article also presents "Narratives" for Humana, including bull and bear cases, to help investors understand contributing factors to its valuation.

feed.title: How New 15% Global Tariff Tensions Could Influence MGM Resorts International’s (MGM) Demand-Sensitive Business
feed.summary: The Trump administration's announcement of a 15% global tariff has created uncertainty for consumer discretionary companies like MGM Resorts International, which relies on travel and entertainment spending. While this policy shift doesn't fundamentally alter MGM's strategy of focusing on digital and premium offerings, it highlights the vulnerability of demand-sensitive industries to geopolitical events. Despite the tariff shock, MGM continues its share repurchase program, aiming to cushion per-share metrics amidst potential earnings volatility.

feed.title: Atmos Energy stock hits all-time high at $182.92
feed.summary: Atmos Energy Corporation's stock reached an all-time high of $182.92, boosting its market capitalization to $30.17 billion, despite an InvestingPro analysis suggesting it is overvalued. The company has seen a 21.85% stock price increase over the past year and has consistently raised its dividend for 33 consecutive years. Recent financial results showed an EPS beat but a revenue miss for Q1 fiscal year 2026, and Jefferies adjusted its price target to $174 with a Hold rating.

feed.title: Teledyne Marine to Debut New System at Oi26
feed.summary: Teledyne Marine will unveil new sonar, navigation, and autonomous marine technologies at Oceanology International 2026 (Oi26) in London, including an exclusive new product launch and integrated dual-head multibeam systems. The event also marks the 50th anniversary of Teledyne RESON, which will host a champagne reception. Live demonstrations on the vessel Maplin will showcase the new SeaBat T51-R Integrated Dual Head multibeam system and Compact Navigator.

feed.title: Laura Howell Implements A Sell Strategy: Offloads $1.13M In Akamai Technologies Stock
feed.summary: Laura Howell, SVP at Akamai Technologies (NASDAQ: AKAM), recently sold 11,273 shares of the company's stock, totaling $1,128,822, as reported in a February 25 SEC filing. Akamai Technologies, a content delivery network provider, is currently trading at $99.58, down 1.29%. The article also reviews Akamai's financial status, highlighting positive revenue growth and strong profitability metrics.

feed.title: President and CEO At Nordson Sells $12.26M Of Stock
feed.summary: Sundaram Nagarajan, President and CEO of Nordson (NASDAQ: NDSN), sold 41,800 shares of the company's stock for a total value of $12,258,268, as disclosed in a recent SEC filing. Nordson, a manufacturer of dispensing equipment, showed positive revenue growth of 0.99% in its most recent quarter but has a high debt-to-equity ratio and a market capitalization below industry benchmarks. Insider transactions are crucial for investment decisions, though insider sells can be motivated by various factors.

feed.title: Nordson Executive Vice President Trades $6.67M In Company Stock
feed.summary: Joseph P. Kelley, Executive Vice President at Nordson (NASDAQ: NDSN), sold 23,052 shares of company stock for a total transaction value of $6,669,276 on February 25, according to an SEC filing. This insider sell occurred while Nordson shares were trading at approximately $291.81. The article also provides an overview of Nordson's business, financial performance, and valuation metrics, noting its high gross margin and above-average debt-to-equity ratio, while explaining the implications of insider transactions for investors.

feed.title: BofA funding connects 86,400 Americans to livable‑wage jobs
feed.summary: Bank of America invested nearly $40 million in 2025 into U.S. workforce development, partnering with over 100 universities and 600 nonprofit organizations. These efforts reportedly helped connect approximately 86,400 people to livable-wage jobs and provided 265,000 individuals with access to training and career readiness programs. The initiative focuses on skills-first hiring and addresses talent shortages across various industries, including healthcare, advanced manufacturing, and technology.

feed.title: Hormel Foods Q1 2026 Earnings Call Transcript
feed.summary: Hormel Foods reported solid Q1 2026 results, with a 2% organic net sales increase and adjusted diluted EPS of $0.34, driven by strong performance in foodservice and international segments despite a decline in retail. The company is strategically shifting its turkey business to focus on value-added products by divesting its whole bird turkey operations to Life Science Innovations. Management reaffirmed its full-year guidance, expecting continued top-line growth and sequential improvement in profitability throughout the year, supported by pricing actions and operational efficiency initiatives.

feed.title: Jim Cramer on Caterpillar: "We Like Their Stuff"
feed.summary: Jim Cramer expressed a positive sentiment towards Caterpillar Inc. (CAT), stating, "We like their stuff," highlighting the company's crucial role in providing essential machinery and services. However, he also advised caution, suggesting investors wait for the stock to be lower before buying, and noted a preference for Cummins (CMI) as a better buy at the moment. Despite acknowledging Caterpillar's potential, the article also suggests that certain AI stocks might offer better upside potential with less downside risk.

feed.title: Insulet (NASDAQ:PODD) Director Michael Minogue Acquires 2,030 Shares of Stock
feed.summary: Insulet Director Michael Minogue recently acquired 2,030 shares of the company's stock for approximately $499,847, increasing his total holdings to 17,483 shares. This transaction comes as Insulet reported strong Q1 results, beating EPS and revenue estimates with significant year-over-year growth. Analysts maintain a "Moderate Buy" consensus for PODD, with an average target price significantly above its current trading level.

feed.title: Brian Caveney Sells 1,500 Shares of Labcorp (NYSE:LH) Stock
feed.summary: Brian Caveney, EVP of Labcorp (NYSE:LH), recently sold 1,500 shares of company stock, reducing his stake by 4.75%. The sale occurred on February 24th at an average price of $286.31, totaling $429,465. Labcorp reported better-than-expected quarterly EPS but slightly missed revenue forecasts and declared a quarterly dividend of $0.72 per share.

feed.title: Target’s new limited-time partnership is with cult-fave Gen Z brand Roller Rabbit
feed.summary: Target has announced a new limited-time design collaboration with Roller Rabbit, an upscale lifestyle brand popular among Gen Z, known for its sleepwear and whimsical prints. The collection, featuring over 250 items across multiple categories, will launch online and in most Target stores on March 7, with nearly 80% of items priced under $35. This partnership aims to introduce Roller Rabbit to a wider audience, expanding into new categories like luggage and outdoor items while offering exclusive in-store products.

feed.title: Teledyne Marine Will Debut New Technologies at Oceanology International 2026
feed.summary: Teledyne Marine will unveil new sonar, navigation, and autonomous marine tech at Oceanology International 2026 in London, including an exclusive product launch and integrated dual-head multibeam systems. The event will also celebrate Teledyne RESON's 50th anniversary, featuring demonstrations and a champagne reception. Visitors can explore various platforms, including a Gavia AUV and the Slocum Sentinel glider.

feed.title: Progyny Q4 2025 Earnings Preview: Revenue Slowdown Anticipated - News and Statistics
feed.summary: Progyny is preparing to report its Q4 2025 earnings, with analysts anticipating a slowdown in revenue growth to 3.3% year-on-year, compared to 10.6% in the prior year's same quarter. The company has previously missed Wall Street's revenue estimates multiple times in the last two years, contrasting with competitors like CVS Health and Cigna who recently exceeded expectations. Progyny's stock has underperformed the sector, dropping 16.3% over the last month, and its current share price is significantly below the average analyst price target.

feed.title: Cyclerion Therapeutics (CYCN) Price Target Increased by 100.00% to 8.16
feed.summary: The average one-year price target for Cyclerion Therapeutics (CYCN) has been increased by 100% to $8.16 per share, up from $4.08. This new target represents a 518.18% increase from its last closing price of $1.32. Institutional ownership in CYCN has seen an increase in total shares owned, despite a decrease in the number of reporting funds.

feed.title: Broadridge extends regulatory platform capabilities
feed.summary: Broadridge Financial Solutions has enhanced its regulatory disclosure platform to help fund manufacturers and distributors comply with the new Consumer Composite Investments (CCI) disclosure framework by the UK Financial Conduct Authority. The updated platform simplifies the creation, management, and digital distribution of FCA-compliant Product Summary Documents through automated data sourcing and validation. This allows firms to adapt to regulatory changes without rebuilding their infrastructure, as stated by Stephen Johnston, Broadridge's head of asset management, regulatory communications solutions Europe.
